name: Sheraton Vistana Villages - International Drive

reviews.text: I am at the Vistana Villages now, and this is the most beautiful place I have ever stayed in the Orlando area. Palm trees everywhere on this 95 acre property with 4 pools, one with a pirate ship and waterslide. The main pool is huge, has a couple waterfalls, two hot tubs and is open until 1AM. Activities all day. Walking paths, grills, hammocks, tiki torches, multiple gyms, game rooms, Free Wi-Fi, No resort fees..etc. The ambiance of this place is just sprawling tropical brilliance set to music (all pool areas play music)! I will absolutely be back!
reviews.title: Best place I have ever stayed in Orlando..95 Acres of gated sprawling tropical brilliance!!

reviews.text: One tip - Don't pick up the 'free welcome gift' or go to the 'free breakfast', unless you don't mind checking out the Sheraton time share stuff. Beyond that they haven't bothered us at all.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel - Can't wait to return!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I spent 9 nights in the Sheraton Vistana Village in early Feb. The suite was huge and beautifully furnished. Housekeeping gave a light tidy everyday (dressed beds/loaded dishwasher etc.) with a big clean being completed on the 5th day. The resort has 3 huge swimming pools and the newest one has a waterslide and pirate themed kiddie area, although it was too cold to fully appreciate in Feb. The hot tub, however, was amazing - too hot if anything! There's one restaurant in the resort and it really wasn't great, not exactly a fine dining experience! You will definitely need a car if staying here as it is at the quieter end of I-Drive. The trolley stops right outside but crossing the road, particularly with children can be dangerous as it's 6 lane with no pedestrian crossing. The road is pretty quiet outside of rush hour. One negative point - beware of staff trying to sell time-share apartments! When we arrived they told us about all these free gifts and Disney discounts we'd get at a complimentary breakfast the next day. However, we read the detail to discover it was an invitation to a 90 minute talk re time-share!!! 90 minutes mightn't sound like much to get really good discounts, but it would have taken up the entire 1st morning as it began at 8am. Early starts are the only way to go if ur hitting the theme parks! Other than this one annoying point I would definitely recommend this hotel and I hope to return in the future!
reviews.title: Fantastic - highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Asked for room at Key West, it was the best room we had ever stayed in.
reviews.title: Superb pad as a base to relax

reviews.text: The decor was very modern, both televisions as well as all the appliances worked.
reviews.title: Gorgeous... Nicest place we have ever stayed!

reviews.text: We really liked the Sheraton Vistana Resort. It is a beautiful resort, even though our room was a bit stuck in the late 80s. It was clean. The people were nice, friendly and helpful. The grounds and the pool were outstanding. If you are doing any of the major resorts, the Vistana is very convenient, especially to Sea World and Discovery Cove. There is a Publix Supermarket and other shopping venues very nearby. The on-sire restaurant, Flagler's was very good and very reasonable. Heck, they had nice service poolside and the Margaritas were good and only $5.00!
reviews.title: Very, very nice resort in Orlando

likes.liked: — Convenient to them parks and shopping
likes.disliked: — our room was a bit small and could have benn more updated

reviews.text: The vistana village is an amazing place to stay if you ahve a group or family. The 2 bed villas are huge and have everything you need. The hotel facilities are extensive and the pool is beautiful. the service at the hotel is a bit naff, took us ages to get breakfast served and drinks in the evening. but overall a good base ofr orlando, seaworld is literally 56 minutes away up international drive.
reviews.title: massive place

reviews.text: Stayed from Feb 16th to Feb 23rd alhough we had been scheduled to arrive on Feb 15th but got caught up in bad weather in the New York area and missed connecting flights. I had read reviews of the Vistana Villages before travelling, and had requested a suite in the Keys part of the complex on the basis of what I read. The accommodation was perfect and left nothing to be desired. However if you plan staying here, do yourself a big favour and decline the invitation to the breakfast sales talk, unless you really intend buying what amounts to an upmarket timeshare. Even the $75 for attending isn't worth it and it takes more than 2 hours, not the 90 minutes they say at the start. On word of advise, if your driving south along I Drive after dark, it can be tricky locating the entrance on the far side of the carraige way.
reviews.title: Top class
Better than its rating
reviews.text: When we booked our trip on Expedia, we requested a room (although they couldn't promise) in the Key West section as so many of the Trip Advisor reviewers recommended. We were so delighted when we discovered how right you all were. The room was clean, luxuriously comfortable (the bed was amazing) and tastefully decorated.If you're a coffee drinker though, pick up some coffee, filters and whatever you put into it because they only give you 1 day's supply.

reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
reviews.text: And although it is close to everything i.e; SeaWorld,Orlando Premium Outlets,Publix Market, Walgreen's - it's nice to have a rental car because this section set back from Int'l Drive.

we stayed here in July 06. If anything this hotel deserves a higher tripadvisor rating. Friendly staff who are helpful. lovely grounds. clean rooms with all the mod cons you are likely to need. Nicely decorated. clean pools
reviews.title: lovely hotel, rooms and grounds. excellent all round

likes.liked: — lovely rooms, nice pools, friendly helpful staff, never seemed crowded, nice grounds
likes.disliked: — this is picky but the bar was a little short of character comparfed to its surroundings.

reviews.text: we were not bothered by any tinmeshare sales, although we did see them around most mornings. If you don't want to see them I would advise unplugging your room phone as I understand this how they contact potential customers.
reviews.title: Perfection

likes.disliked: — On one occassion-housekeeping knocked once ONLY and then immediately entered our room before we said come in

reviews.text: We are going back in march 07. Stay here. You'll love it.
reviews.title: Great place and location, superb!

reviews.text: My family of four stayed here from February 16, 2007 thru February 22, 2007. We absolutely loved it!!!! We plan to go again and again and again! The accomodations were more than acceptable, the cleanliness was excellent. We didn't go to the restaurant. Our room had a full kitchen with lots of dishes---basically everything one needed to prepare meals. The area surrounding this property was great-great shopping, great nightlife, close to Seaworld, close to Disney. We loved it and we advise many to go and check it out for yourself!
reviews.title: Excellent stay at Sheraton Vistanta Villages

reviews.text: We arrived home on Friday 15th Feb having stayed at the Sheraton Vistana Villages for a week and we had a fantastic time. The accommodation is of a very high standard and spotlessly clean and well equipped. We had a two bedroom apartment, which was very spacious and could sleep up to 8, although I would imagine you would feel slightly cramped with this amount of people. I have only one criticism, if you eat in the restaurant, everything is served on plastic plates, you eat with plastic cutlery and the wine was served in a plastic cup, certainly not the five star that the complex would have you believe, otherwise great.
reviews.title: Great Complex with fab facilities. UK

likes.liked: — very clean and modern with an excellent location
likes.disliked: — room service, maid service not consistent

reviews.text: As owners in the SPG network and a very long term reservation, we would have expected a much better effort at accommodating our request for our stay ~ elderly and children! They put us in the two
reviews.title: Disappointment from the 1st day! Stay anyplace else!

reviews.text: Worst 2 bedroom lock off units on the entire property (a total of 4 bedrooms and lots of bucks) with a view of an asphalt shingle roof at both! Don't buy into their property or stay here!!! You will be disappointed!
reviews.title: Update needed / timeshare issue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a week - Feb 21 - 28 2013, not what expected. Front desk staff were not very friendly upon initial visit to inquire if room was available around 12:00 on day of arrival. Concierge and bellman staff were extremely friendly, helpful and accommodating.
reviews.title: Villages always makes me feel very spoiled

reviews.text: Room was not ready until after 4:00pm as hotel was "busy". When finally checked in room - looked like a fast once over was given to floors as there was threads on carpet, tinfoil on floor, bathtub and shower doors looked as if they were not cleaned - housekeeping staff came to room and minimized concerns. Decor of room, furniture, and carpets were dated, worn and in need of update or replacement.
reviews.title: Like home away from home.

reviews.text: Elevator for building one smells of garbage daily, asked other guests whom agreed.
reviews.title: Awesome stay

reviews.text: My family (Wife, Toddler and Infant) and I stayed at Sheraton Vistana Villages in early March 2007. The resort was great. The staff were friendly. Room was clean upon arrival and exactly like the pictures showed. It was a great deal for the money. We only had two negatives abotu our 4 day stay. A few times the room card key reader did not work and allow us to get in (we called the front desk and they fixed the problem each time) and one day our maid service did not come until after 4 pm. The maid that cleaned our room that day, did an amazing job. We plan on going back.
reviews.title: Loved Sheraton Vistana Villages

reviews.text: The Sheraton is building villas like crazy! We booked this vacation in January and requested the "newer Keys section" as suggested by many of these reviews. We checked in, and to our surprise there was an even newer section! So new, in fact, that we were the very first to stay in the room! How cool is that?
reviews.title: Can something be too new?

likes.liked: — Proximity to Sea World and Supermarket

reviews.text: This newest section is named "Amelia". The rooms are very, very nice. The view is currently large mountains of dirt. The frogs in the man-made basins come alive in the evenings and appear to be louder than the planes overhead. They actually sound like dogs. Not a problem at all with that though, it surely beats the sounds of the city! Anyway, the villas are large, decorated very nicely, and have everything you could need.
reviews.title: Horrible Check-In Experience

likes.liked: — It's very clean and well-maintained, love the screen-in patio
likes.disliked: — the check-in process -- very poor management

reviews.text: We rented a 2 bedroom villa - it had three (yes 3!) flat panel televisions! It'll be really nice when the cable company sends a high-def signal!
reviews.title: What, are you kidding me....this place is beyond fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downside is the walk to the main pool. It's a hike. They've got plans to build another pool in this section along with an outdoor bar, etc. There are also grills located at each villa complex. That is a very nice feature should you decide to grill some food!
reviews.title: Stay Here, Great Time.

reviews.text: We had a great time at the Sheraton Vistana I Drive, just ignore the time share sales pitch. There was a post about a bad experience that made me cautious. The 2 bedroom condo was great. The pools and grounds were well kept and the some of the pools stayed open to 1 am (traveling with young adults) Best housekeeping ever!
reviews.title: Family of 6, ignore the timeshare sales pitch

reviews.text: tI was good to have a heads up about the Vacation/timeshare pitch. When I checked in, I was sent to recieve a "welcome package" bascially coupons and asked to sign up for free breakfast (sale pitch) I declined. I returned to hotel and there was a message "Don't forget to pick up welcome package and free breakfast (sales pitch) there was yet another phone call about our reservation for breakfast ( sales pitch) In the end, they were easy to ignore and the place was great. The location is 5 mins from WDW and away from traffic. There is a nearby Publix grocery store and several restaurants...Great visit, great place to say
reviews.title: This is not a hotel but blocks of time share apartments
Nice Place to Stay
reviews.text: Stayed here in a two bedroomed apartment, which was a good size. It is a time share development so you will be called numerous times, we just ignored the phone and the voice mails. Check in was slow but all the staff were friendly. Good size pools and grounds are well maintained. Our apartment was cleaned daily but it was only a basic clean so don't expect too much. If you wanted to cook in the apartment you had everything you needed, including a dishwasher and washing machine and dryer. If that is the holiday you want then these apartment would be great.

We did want a bit more luxury and Vistana Villages does not have that. It is a large complex, which does get busy, the apartments are in blocks with corridors open to the elements and all the animals that go through the bins every night!!
reviews.title: Nice place!

reviews.text: There is only one restaurant on the complex, which was good, but it was not fine dining! It was too far from the restaurants at Pointe Orlando for us.
reviews.title: Sheraton Vistana Villages International Dr.

reviews.text: There were 5 of us, three adults and 2 toddlers, in a two bedroom unit in Building 10. It was a very enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Impressive and Enjoyable

reviews.text: The beds were comfortable and there was adequate space for everyone in the unit. We had to get the staff to change the sheets on the beds to more softer sheets but that was not a big deal.
reviews.title: Bad stay gets worst
I love this place!!
reviews.text: Everything was within walking distance including Pool, Game Room, Cafe etc. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The grounds were well kept and modern. I really enjoyed the BBQ areas and the new Stainless Steel BBQs. They had lights so you could cook at night and given it was Dec, darkness appeared just at dinner time.

The Pool was huge and heated. There was a nice portion of the pool for the kids to play in but you couldn't stay out of the water too long due to the chill in the air. The change room was large and clean which made for a nice swimming experience.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place to stay

reviews.text: I had a chance to stay in the Sheraton Vistana Resort and let me tell you, I would take Villages over the Resort any day. The Resort was dated and seemed very cramped by comparison.
reviews.title: Love this place! Terrific rooms with everything you could want!

reviews.text: We ( my wife, 2 daughters aged 6 & 10 and I) recently stayed at the Vistana Villages for 15 nights over Christmas and New Year 2007/8.
reviews.title: Two Thumbs Up !!!

likes.liked: — Size of the apartment and the overall cleanliness of the complex
likes.disliked: — Some building work - although this didn't affect us in any way

reviews.text: Following advice from members on the Trip Advisor Forum we selected the Keys area which is at the quieter end of the Complex in a 2 bedroomed apartment (Block 16- Apartment 403).
reviews.title: Great Place for Large Families

likes.liked: — The space and the flat screen tvs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we were very impressed with the resort and would break down our experiences as follows :-
reviews.title: Not too impressed

reviews.text: Reception / Check In : Very Friendly and helpful. Our pre-arrival request for the Keys had been accomodated (would definitely recommend that you phone ahead if you have a specific request such as ours) We had 2 minor issues - our room safe didn't open and our washing machine initially didn't work. Both were resolved quickly and with the minimum of fuss.
reviews.title: Nice place, rooms noisy!

reviews.text: Timeshare salespeople : Like everyone else, we were given a welcome pack with money off vouchers and offered initially $100 then $150 cash to attend the breakfast meeting to discuss their "exciting ownership opportunities". After we refused, we were left alone with the exception of a follow up call a couple of days later which we missed as we were out at the parks.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for two weeks in Aug 2012 in a two bed villa. The whole complex was spotless and well kept. There were five of us, three adults and two children, and we had loads of space. We had an apartment overlooking St Augustine pool, which was fantastic. The complex is in a fabulous spot just down the road from SeaWorld and half way between Disney and universal studios. There is complementary transport to Disney and the I trolley stops outside the complex entrance. This was our first holiday at Disney and staying here just made the holiday perfect.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the one bedroom condo at the back of the property. Very quite. Right next to the heated pool and beach front with a BBQ pit next to one of the retention ponds. The wi-fi worked very well. The room was nice and clean. The kitchenette was great and saved us time and money being able to cook in our room. We enjoyed our stay and will definitely stay there again. As stated by other an reviewer, bobby_bat, "it’s a resort/time-share and so, there is no daily service on offer and you will be bugged about buying a time-share. BUT: if you are not interested in owning an apartment there, it will not ruin your time there is you follow a couple of simple tips. Firstly you don't have to pick up the "welcome pack" upon arrival and check-in if you don't want to. Secondly (and most importantly), as mentioned by a previous reviewer and the best advice I received before staying there, definitely unplug the phones the moment you arrive in your apartment otherwise you will be bugged with sales calls & presentation requests."
reviews.title: Sheraton Vistana Villages - International Drive

reviews.text: We stay at this hotel every year on our annual Disney vacation. We love the location on International Drive -- it is close to the parks, but out of the way of most of the traffic. For an amazing price, we get a villa, instead of a single hotel room, like you would if you stayed on "property." The kitchen is essential to us, because we enjoy making breakfast in our room and packing lunches to bring into the parks. The grocery store is just down the road so you can stock up! We love the 2 bdrm villa, because we can put the kids to sleep without disturbing them by staying awake. We book this hotel through Costco and always receive great service!
reviews.title: Home Away From Home
Orlando condos
reviews.text: We stayed in the two bedroom condo and it was well laid out, in a quiet section, good housekeeping and nice pools. BBQ pits and full kitchen made cooking or take out easy as found there were not a lot of great restaurants close buy...but easy access to Universal or Disney. We would stay again if returning to Orlando.
Orlando Reviews:
reviews.title: Huge family/car friendly property
No Vacation Here, Especially for Handicapped
reviews.text: Vistana's Vacation Villages is not new to us. We are time share owners at the Vistana Resorts. We had some extra time and points available and wanted to see Epcot's Flower Show( a real delight ) so we reserved a single bedroom villa at the Villages.  Check in went smoothly, everyone is super polite and accommodating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now come the cons: we were given a handicapped accessible room (we did not need this, nor did we ask for it.). Our fault for not asking for a change of room immediately.  This room is poorly designed, especially for the handicapped. The lack of a towel bar near the sink, the necessity to go to three different switches to turn on the bathroom lights,(would a bank of lights switches been that difficult to achieve?). And the open "glassless window" from the bedroom to the bathroom,what purpose does that serve, except to allow all bathroom sounds into the bedroom!  There is zero soundproofing between the rooms, needless to say we did not like this facility at all!
reviews.title: Update

reviews.text: There were some little nuisance problems as well with the hot water and the ice maker in the fridge, they were responsive, and promised me a bag of ice instead. Imagine our surprise when returning to find a bag of ice melting in the sink, instead of being placed into the freezer!
reviews.title: Great location in central Florida

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is amazing that my last review of this hotel was so good and this time it is going to be so poor.
reviews.title: Nice property with lots of families and 100% occupancy.

reviews.text: Checked in and had to change room 3 times. First room had not 1 but 2 connecting doors and could hear everything going on in other rooms. The second room I was told had no connecting doors, but get to room and 1 connecting door and could hear TV blasting . Went back to front desk where they informed me that all 1 bedroom villas have at least 1 connecting door! But they would fix situation by putting me in 2 bedroom which was $80 more, but they would discount. Also, this time the first villa was in the back section, Key West? or something, not as nice as front area, older maybe. Other problems were sales people calling eary to try to get us to view timeshare and housekeeping knocking early and repeatedly.
reviews.title: Great Disney Family Vacation Spot
Beautiful Place, Lousy Service
reviews.text: This is our first time stay at the Vistana Villages -International drive..we are timeshare owners and traded to stay here...This is a beautiful looking resort, nice large pool, we stayed in a one bedroom villa...quiet overlooking a lake...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One thing we did not like was not having maid service on a daily basis, we kept calling for new towels, toliet paper, shampoo, soap...had to call a few times before we get them...poor service in that way...
reviews.title: Clean and Freshly Kept Rooms

likes.liked: — Very clean and free wireless Internet connection

reviews.text: The sheraton shuttles to the theme parks are never on time which gets annoying....
reviews.title: Very disappointed in comparison to previous visit

likes.liked: — The amount of space, the convenience, activities staff
likes.disliked: — High pressure sales staff and very poor customer service

reviews.text: It was my husband and I (no kids yet) and I felt that it was nice that they had a lot of kids activities but not much for adults it would of been nice like one or two of the nights out of the week do something for couples not everyone has kids.
reviews.title: Loved Vistana Village

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very noisy there is construction going on and when someone closes there villa door you can hear it a mile away.
reviews.title: noise, animals, and loud construction noises

likes.liked: — the gardens, and the lakes, and the pool

reviews.text: We stayed in 28-306 on an paid getaway booked through Interval International. Our two bedroom unit was about as far away and out of sight from the pools and facilities as could be. A security employee told us they "never put Interval Exchange guests in the newest part of the resort" Carpet was very dated and furniture seemed old, scratched, and poorly upholstered. It bore little resemblance to the rooms shown to us at the same resort by the preview center sales team. After an amiable sales presentation we agreed to attend, we were told we had to decide while we were there, or there could be "no deal." We would never invest without having time to think about it and do some research, "April" said we did not have that option, that we had to decide while we were there in Florida. I call that high pressure and they lost a potantial buyer with that tactic. We already own in Hyatt vacation club and were considering buying more points for greater trading power, but their Starwood high pressure tactics totally turned us off.
reviews.title: Good location to Disney, but inconsistent quality. Beware sales pitch

reviews.text: We decided to stay at the Sheraton Vistana Villages International Drive resort for a 14 day stay in Orlando , after a 24 hour drive from Canada we arrived and were impressed by the view entering the property and also with security at the front gate . upon entering the lobby check in went fairly quick and they had issued us card keys for a ground floor room in the Amelia area of the resort , once arriving at our assigned room the card keys did not work so we ended up driving back to the main building where they then noticed that they had written the wrong room number on the key card envelope not a big deal simple mistake , once going to the correct room and hauling our suitcases and stuff to the room we entered and noticed the room had been recently used and dirty with dirty Kleenexes and trash left behind from its previous occupants . I then picked up the phone in the room and pressed the Guest Services button where I was quickly connected to a lady on the other end, I explained to her that they had checked us into a room that was dirty and not yet cleaned , she then told me to hold while she looked for a new room for us saying she now had a clean room for us in a newer building on a upper floor and to stay where we are now and the bellman would bring us new cards for our new clean room and he should be there in a few minutes with the cards , we waited in the dirty room for about 20 minutes for our new cards to arrive which they never did , so again pack everything back into the car and drive back to the main building , very frustrated at this point explaining what was going on they provided us the new key cards and the new room number . Driving to the newly assigned building we noticed it was fairly new our room was better than expected with all new appliances huge bathroom great size Jacuzzi tub and great view of a pond with a fountain, our king bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed sleeping in it every night.
reviews.title: Best place for us in Orlando so far

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE GOOD .
reviews.title: Decent resort, would stay there again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are very well kept and very clean and attractive. Lots of parking was always available.
reviews.title: Didn't Want to Leave!!! BEAUTIFUL....

reviews.text: The room was very nice clean and modern beds very nice comfy nice private balcony with beautiful view, huge shower and bathroom with 2 sinks , great to have a washer & dryer in our suite that we used twice, LG TV DVD player and ipod dock in the living room was great also LG TV in the bedroom was nice to relax too before sleeping , digital safe in the closet is easy to use. The rooms are very soundproof we were not disturbed by other units our entire time even with people staying in the next units. Free WiFi internet works great on the resort with the signal in the excellent to very good signal range with no problems. This has to be the best condo apartment we have stayed at so far
reviews.title: Just Right

reviews.text: The condos are spacious and clean, the property is beautiful; however, the service is horrible!
reviews.title: Service Horrible
Nice Property
reviews.text: The staff at the restaurant were the most unfriendly people I dealt w/throughout my entire vacation. We waited over 40 minutes to recieve our dinner after ordering one night, and the following morning I waited 15 minutes for a latte. There was no one in line in front of me! Ridiculous. Not only was the service slow, but not once did the wait staff crack a smile.
Our days at the pool involved waiting for towels. You'd think such a large facility would be prepared with enough pool towels for its guests. There were also not enough lounge chairs at the pool.
reviews.title: Had a great family vacation!

reviews.text: We tried to use the activities desk to buy our Disney tickets, but their machine to issue the tickets was broken. How convenient! We also called and asked for extra hangers to be delivered twice. The first time they brought us more towels, and after no response to our second request, we gave up.
reviews.title: Not Enough Staff for Spring Break!

likes.liked: — THE ROOM WE WERE TRANSFERRED TO

reviews.text: With some staffing improvements, this could be a great property. I hope others have better luck!
reviews.title: Nice, clean, non-descript

likes.disliked: — Living room pull-out was very uncomfortable

reviews.text: Stayed at VV through a timeshare exchange. We loved the place. Really nice setting with security so were were not too concerned about the kids.
reviews.title: We haed a great time at VV!

reviews.text: Check in was a little slow, but other than that everything was fine. Had a nice big 2 bedroom condo w/kitchen. Nicely decorated. The pool was huge, just a little cool, but the kids didn't mind.
reviews.title: Absolutely Lovely!

likes.liked: — Location. We were very central for Disney Parks and Universal. Plus we were not in the crowded, noisy part of International Drive which was definately a plus!
likes.disliked: — The small pool outside our 'Keys' Apartment was cold.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They had nightly entertainment, went to a show and played in the Texas Hold'em Tournement (I won a $20 Gift Certificate to the Restaurant). Very reasonably priced meals for the kids (about $5 for Chiken strips and fries) and good (nothing spectacular)appetizers for the adults.
reviews.title: Loved the facilities, but check the suite doors

reviews.text: We would go back.
reviews.title: Nothing but the finest!

reviews.text: We stayed here for two weeks and had an absolutely amazing time! We were in the new Keys area which was lovely. The apartment was very clean and i loved the fly nets on all windows/patio areas - such a good idea. The kitchen was fabulous and the bathroom, well words can't describe how amazing that was! Two sinks, spa bath, large open shower... gorgeous. We were exhausted everyday from Disney so to come back to this hotel was lovely. The food at the hotel was well cooked, not much choice but value for money. The hotel pool outside our hotel room was cold!!! but didn't stop my daughter going in. The main pool was lovely and warm though so I did venture in there. If you are considering this hotel, then I would definately recommend it for ease of getting around Orlando as well as lovely and relaxing at the end of your busy days.
reviews.title: perfect

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at Vistana Resort in Orland in Dec of ’09. We stay in the Lakes area in a newly remodeled room – the furniture and décor was beautiful, very nice bathrooms. It was very quiet, though I suspect we stayed during off season. I was also impressed with their security making sure to check every car and pedestrian who enters. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Beautiful Room at a Great Value

reviews.text: sheraton vistana villages is immaculate,the atmosphere is good kids loved it. Our room was lovely even though we were in the older gardens section it was still lovely. the only downside was there was a lot of noise from above and next door apartments so ask for top floor. The pool was great for kids we stayed over halloween and the party they put on was fantastic. The other let down was there was only one small expensive cafe for the whole of the complex and one small shop but the publix supermarket is 2minute drive.To stay here I would definatley recommend a car as it is at the bottom of international drive and nowhere is in walking distance ,but the location is ideal for disney and interntional drive.They do want you to go to the owners meeting but you dont have too,we went and got $75 and half price park tickets which was worth a couple of hours of head pecking at the end you just say no thanks and walk away. Overall we had a great stay.
reviews.title: great place to stay

reviews.text: I decided to give this property a try since I was able to get the great price of $69 per night and plus it was part of the Starwood family (As of Jan 2010 it will no longer be a Starwood property). The property is gorgeous!! They put me in Building 17 at the very back of the property. I was very pleased with my room. It was so quiet and I never heard another person the whole time I was there. Very nicely decorated and I loved the little kitchen it had. There was a small problem with the shower liner. When I walk into the room I could smell a strong odor of mold/mildew and I knew it was probably coming from the showe liner. When I pulled the shower curtain back, Good Golly Miss Molly, there was several large spots of mold on the liner. The next morning, when I left for the day, I showed the girl at the front desk the photos I took of the liner and explained that it really needed to be changed. Now, my room did not come with maid service with the price I received, but they came in and did a VIP cleaing (at no charge) and changed the liner. I would not let this incident discourage anyone from staying at this great property. I would highly recommend these condos and it would be a great place for families that stay for a week or two at a time. It is about a 10-15 minute drive to Universal Studios and for all the those who like to shop at high-end outlet stores, there is a Premium outlet store 2 minutes from this property and the Prime Outlet is a 5 minute drive from Universal Studios. This is a great place and I would definitely stay here again when I come back to Orlando. Happy Traveling!!!
reviews.title: Great place, but check shower liner in bathroom

reviews.text: As a group of four adults we stayed at Vistana Villages for a trip to DisneyWorld. We got a great low-season rate of $129/night (the no-housekeeping rate) for a 2/2 thru Travelocity and couldn't pass it up after seeing all the good reviews here at TripAdvisor.
reviews.title: All the good reviews are true - great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The suite was an ideal set-up for us: 2 bedrooms, two baths, and each bath had dual sinks. The master had a good king bed, a jacuzzi tub, and a separate shower. The other bedroom had two queens. Beds were comfortable, but the linens were a bit crisp!
reviews.title: Five Stars for a Five Star - Great!

reviews.text: We are timeshare owners and traded our regular timeshare for Vistana... It was well beyond our expectations....we stayed in the garden building #10 ground floor -- not 1 complaint about our stay -- the grounds were well kept, rooms were immaculate, staff was helpful and friendly -- what more could u ask for?? -- and great location....minutes from Disney and Universal -- right in the center of all shopping -- loved Vistana --- Highly recommended!! Cannot wait to return..
reviews.title: Loved the Vistana Villages

reviews.text: We recently returned from the Sheraton Vistana Villages, International Drive, what a great place to stay, the accomodation is everything you could hope for, very clean and modern, I would suggest taking a travel kettle if you want you morning tea in a hurry, they use kettles that go on the cooker so it takes its time to boil. The pools are great and well heated. There is a shop on site that keep the basics, its not that good. The I Ride runs the full lenght of International Drive, there are 43 stops and it costs $1 per ride, I would suggest getting a week pass from the hotel for $9, worth every penny, the Sheraton Vistana Villages, International Drive is at I ride stop 39, the quiet end, if you catch it to stop 42 there is a supermarket (PUBLIX) that sells everything you need, if you want English items, tea bags, Nescafe, UK jams take your own as they cost double what you would pay here.
reviews.title: Fantastic Place

reviews.text: Take advantage of the coupon books, you find them every where, they give you money off everything from food to cloths, there are also stall selling tickets for Disney, the other parks and shows, its the cheapest way to do it. We did not have a car and you don't need one. We used the I Ride for everything, it's a great service, it's a shame we don't have one back home.
reviews.title: perfect!

reviews.text: I could write a book on what to do and not to do, if you have any questions please e-mail me joe@jhoward7.wanadoo.co.uk and I will help if I can.
reviews.title: Recommended, would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are going back to the same place in 2009, can wait.
reviews.title: beyond our expectations---phenomenal

description: The Sheraton Vistana Villages Resort Villas, I-Drive/Orlando is an attraction in and of itself. Fully furnished villas wind throughout the property, creating an atmosphere of tranquility and privacy.
